alert.note: Alert for Grand (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 2:22PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Northeastern Grand County and far southwest Larimer County, including the East Troublesome burn scar. * WHEN...Until 530 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 219 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated areas of heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This may cause small stream flooding and runoff in burn areas. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches will be possible over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Granby, Bear Lake, Grand Lake and Deer Ridge. - This includes the following additional locations... Rocky Mountain National Park west entrance, Green Mountain in Rocky Mountain National Park, Cascade Falls in Rocky Mountain National Park, North Inlet in Grand Lake, Columbine Lake, rising water in the Colorado River along River Rd, Lower Stillwater Creek, Stillwater Pass, Upper Willow Creek Valley, Middle Willow Creek Valley, Lower Willow Creek Valley, Drowsy Water Ranch, Elk Mountain, Remote East Troublesome Headwaters, East Troublesome Valley and Upper Corral Creek Valley.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Heavy Rainfall will cause minor flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the East Troublesome burn area. The heavy rains could also trigger rock slides or debris flows. Heavy Rainfall will cause minor flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the East Troublesome burn area. Some areas affected include the Spruce, Fern, and Mill Creek basins in Rocky Mountain National Park and the Moraine Park area.
